revised_title: Mechanics of Two-Dimensional Cellular Materials: Analysis and Experiments
tldr: This article analyzes the mechanical properties of two-dimensional cellular materials, or honeycombs, and compares them with experiments. The properties are well described in terms of bending, elastic buckling, and plastic collapse of the cell walls. The authors test silicone rubber models and metal honeycombs to validate their analysis, which is essential for understanding the mechanics of three-dimensional cellular solids.
